authors.author: Johann Michael Haydn Robert Grant William Gardiner

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O worship the King, newline All glorious above, newline And gratefully sing newline His power and His love: newline Our Shield and Defender, newline The Ancient of Days, newline Pavilioned in splendor, newline And girded with praise.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: O tell of His might, newline And sing of His grace, newline Whose robe is the light, newline Whose canopy space. newline His chariots of wrath, newline The deep thunderclouds form, newline And dark is His path newline On the wings of the storm.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Thy bountiful care, newline What tongue can recite? newline It breathes in the air; newline It shines in the light. newline It streams from the hills; newline It descends to the plain, newline And sweetly distills newline In the dew and the rain.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Frail children of dust, newline And feeble as frail, newline In Thee do we trust, newline Nor find Thee to fail. newline Thy mercies how tender! newline How firm to the end! newline Our Maker, Defender, newline Redeemer, and Friend!
